title: Betws Y Coed River Walk Route

nearby.description: Fishermans Walk and Lledr Gorge Walk

images.title: Trevor Rickard / River Bank at Betws-y-Coed
images.caption: River Bank at Betws-y-Coed

images.title: Eric Jones / Afon Conwy from the Sapper's bridge
images.caption: Afon Conwy from the Sapper's bridge

images.title: Chris Carlson / Braided Channel of the Afon Conwy
images.caption: Braided Channel of the Afon Conwy. Here the River shows signs of braiding, unusually 30km from the sea, these islands are usually temporary but however vegetation has colonised this one and it has become permanent. Taken on a field course at the local field centre.

images.title: Bob Abell / Rail bridge at Betws-y-coed
images.caption: Rail bridge at Betws-y-coed. River Llugwy passing below rail line from BYC to Llandudno. The Llugwy joins the River Conwy about 1/4 mile down stream.

images.title: Afon Llugwy, Betws-y-Coed by Jaggery, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Afon Llugwy in spring.

images.title: Richard Hoare / Cafe with a difference
images.caption: Cafe with a difference. Converted rail carriages now form a cafeteria in the sidings at Betws-y-coed Station.

images.title: Betws-y-coed: Pont-y-Pair Bridge by Chris Downer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waterfalls at Pont-y-Pair Bridge

description: A circular walk along the River Llugy and the River Conwy in the Snowdonia village of Betws Y Coed. The short walk takes you along footpaths where the two rivers converge, close to the train station and the village centre. You can start the walk from the Snowdonia National Park Visitor Centre or from the train station. Paths will then take you around the golf course and along the rushing waters of the rivers. There's nice views across the water to the surrounding woodland and mountains of the area. You can continue your riverside walking by following the Afon Llugy west and visiting the delightful Swallow Falls and the picturesque wooden Miners Bridge . Also nearby are the Conwy Falls where there are good trails to follow along the River Conwy. To the south is the delightful Fairy Glen where there's little waterfalls, rapids and cascades in a picturesque wooded gorge.
